DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to assess the quality of wound healing in abdominal scars with and without the Prevena Incision Management System. The hypothesis is that Prevena will lead to improved wound healing with less swelling, bruising, and inflammation, as well as less potential for infection, seroma, and dehiscence.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Observation of Wound Healing With Prevena Incision Management System
DOC.detailed_description: The quality of wound healing can be of the utmost importance for patients undergoing large abdominal surgery. Incisional negative pressure wound therapy has been observed to decrease seroma and infection rates in high risk patients. This study aims to quantify the effect, if any, that negative pressure wound therapy has on closed incisions. The technology may provide benefits even in lower risk patients.
DOC.criteria: abdominal procedure with incision >20cm must be >18 years of age <18 years of age history of allergy or reaction to adhesives pregnant or anticipated pregnancy within 6 months
